metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18198 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.Description:
print_iso9660_recurse in iso-info.c in GNU libcdio before 1.0.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted iso file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18198` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcdio++1 - 1.0.0-2
libcdio-utils - 1.0.0-2
libcdio19 - 1.0.0-2
libiso9660++0 - 1.0.0-2
libiso9660-11 - 1.0.0-2
libudf0 - 1.0.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libcdio package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.0-2').
